quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: Give, even if you only have a little.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: There is no fear for one whose mind is not filled with desires.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: Even death is not to be feared by one who has lived wisely.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: Irrigators channel waters; fletchers straighten arrows; carpenters bend wood; the wise master themselves.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: Drop by drop is the water pot filled. Likewise, the wise man, gathering it little by little, fills himself with good.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: Better than a thousand hollow words, is one word that brings peace.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: If you knew what I know about the power of giving, you would not let a single meal pass without sharing it in some way.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: The root of suffering is attachment.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: Silence the angry man with love. Silence the ill-natured man with kindness. Silence the miser with generosity. Silence the liar with truth.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: People with opinions just go around bothering each other.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: Even as a solid rock is unshaken by the wind, so are the wise unshaken by praise or blame.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: You yourself must strive. The Buddhas only point the way.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: Nothing can harm you as much as your own thoughts unguarded.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: Meditate… do not delay, lest you later regret it.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: Understanding is the heartwood of well-spoken words.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: Ceasing to do evil, Cultivating the good, Purifying the heart: This is the teaching of the Buddhas.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: Delight in meditation and solitude. Compose yourself, be happy. You are a seeker.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: Ardently do today what must be done. Who knows? Tomorrow, death comes.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: Purity and impurity depend on oneself; no one can purify another.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: What you are is what you have been. What you’ll be is what you do now.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: If you propose to speak always ask yourself, is it true, is it necessary, is it kind.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: If you find no one to support you on the spiritual path, walk alone. (This is one of my favorite Buddha quote. Leave a reply and let me know what’s yours!)

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: If anything is worth doing, do it with all your heart. Buddha

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: A man is not called wise because he talks and talks again; but if he is peaceful, loving and fearless then he is in truth called wise. Buddha

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: All that we are is the result of what we have thought. Buddha

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: Stop, stop. Do not speak. The ultimate truth is not even to think.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: No one saves us but ourselves. No one can and no one may. We ourselves must walk the path.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: We are what we think. All that we are arises with our thoughts. With our thoughts, we make the world.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: Just as the great ocean has one taste, the taste of salt, so also this teaching and discipline has one taste, the taste of liberation.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: The one in whom no longer exist the craving and thirst that perpetuate becoming; how could you track that Awakened one, trackless, and of limitless range.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: Endurance is one of the most difficult disciplines, but it is to the one who endures that the final victory comes.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: Long is the night to him who is awake; long is a mile to him who is tired; long is life to the foolish who do not know the true law.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: Whatever precious jewel there is in the heavenly worlds, there is nothing comparable to one who is Awakened.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: Our life is shaped by our mind; we become what we think. Joy follows a pure thought like a shadow that never leaves.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: Like a fine flower, beautiful to look at but without scent, fine words are fruitless in a man who does not act in accordance with them.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: Our theories of the eternal are as valuable as are those which a chick which has not broken its way through its shell might form of the outside world.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: An idea that is developed and put into action is more important than an idea that exists only as an idea.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: However many holy words you read, however many you speak, what good will they do you if you do not act on upon them?

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: Chaos is inherent in all compounded things. Strive on with diligence.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: Work out your own salvation. Do not depend on others.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: Attachment leads to suffering.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: May all beings have happy minds.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: Born out of concern for all beings.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: I am the miracle.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: You only lose what you cling to.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: A jug fills drop by drop.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: One who acts on truth is happy in this world and beyond.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: Every human being is the author of his own health or disease.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: The tongue like a sharp knife… Kills without drawing blood.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: The way is not in the sky. The way is in the heart.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: The mind is everything. What you think you become.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: Peace comes from within. Do not seek it without.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: You can only lose what you cling to.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: I never see what has been done; I only see what remains to be done.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: As you walk and eat and travel, be where you are. Otherwise you will miss most of your life.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: The only real failure in life is not to be true to the best one knows.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: A man asked Gautama Buddha, “I want happiness.” Buddha said, “First remove “I,” that’s Ego, then remove “want,” that’s Desire. See now, you are left with only “Happiness”.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: A family is a place where minds come in contact with one another.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: Believe nothing, no matter where you read it, or who said it, no matter if I have said it, unless it agrees with your own reason and your own common sense.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: If your compassion does not include yourself, it is incomplete.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: In the end, only three things matter: how much you loved, how gently you lived, and how gracefully you let go of things not meant for you.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: The foot feels the foot when it feels the ground.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: A dog is not considered a good dog because he is a good barker. A man is not considered a good man because he is a good talker.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: If we destroy something around us we destroy ourselves. If we cheat another, we cheat ourselves.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: Every experience, no matter how bad it seems, holds within it a blessing of some kind. The goal is to find it.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: Doubt everything. Find your own light.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: A generous heart, kind speech, and a life of service and compassion are the things which renew humanity.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: Just as a snake sheds its skin, we must shed our past over and over again.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: When you realize how perfect everything is you will tilt your head back and laugh at the sky.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: Meditate. Live purely. Be quiet. Do your work with mastery. Like the moon, come out from behind the clouds! Shine.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: My doctrine is not a doctrine but just a vision. I have not given you any set rules, I have not given you a system.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: In the sky, there is no distinction of east and west; people create distinctions out of their own minds and then believe them to be true.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: Holding on to anger is like grasping a hot coal with the intent of throwing it at someone else; you are the one who gets burned.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: What you think you create, what you feel you attract, what you imagine you become.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: Your work is to discover your world and then with all your heart give yourself to it.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: There has to be evil so that good can prove its purity above it.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: When you like a flower, you just pluck it. But when you love a flower, you water it daily.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: It is better to travel well than to arrive.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: It is better to conquer yourself than to win a thousand battles. Then the victory is yours. It cannot be taken from you, not by angels or by demons, heaven or hell.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: If you truly loved yourself, you could never hurt another.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: Every morning we are born again. What we do today is what matters most.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: Life is so very hard. How can we be anything but kind?

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: Live every act fully, as if it were your last.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: Virtue is persecuted more by the wicked than it is loved by the good.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: Nothing ever exists entirely alone; everything is in relation to everything else.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: Purity or impurity depends on oneself. No one can purify another.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: To support mother and father, to cherish wife and child and to have a simple livelihood; this is the good luck.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: One moment can change a day, one day can change a life and one life can change the world.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: If we fail to look after others when they need help, who will look after us?

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: To live a pure unselfish life, one must count nothing as one’s own in the midst of abundance.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: She who knows life flows, feels no wear or tear, needs no mending or repair.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: An insincere and evil friend is more to be feared than a wild beast; a wild beast may wound your body, but an evil friend will wound your mind.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: Whatever words we utter should be chosen with care for people will hear them and be influenced by them for good or ill.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: To be idle is a short road to death and to be diligent is a way of life; foolish people are idle, wise people are diligent.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: Should a seeker not find a companion who is better or equal, let them resolutely pursue a solitary course.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: If we could see the miracle of a single flower clearly, our whole life would change.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: True love is born from understanding.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: Radiate boundless love towards the entire world.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: You, yourself, as much as anybody in the entire universe, deserve your love and affection.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: Ambition is like love, impatient both of delays and rivals.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: Love is a gift of one’s inner most soul to another so both can be whole.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: Let all-embracing thoughts for all beings be yours.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: We will develop and cultivate the liberation of mind by lovingkindness, make it our vehicle, make it our basis, stabilize it, exercise ourselves in it, and fully perfect it.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: Hatred does not cease through hatred at any time. Hatred ceases through love. This is an unalterable law.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: As rain falls equally on the just and the unjust, do not burden your heart with judgments but rain your kindness equally on all.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: He who loves 50 people has 50 woes; he who loves no one has no woes.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: Kindness should become the natural way of life, not the exception.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: Speak only endearing speech, speech that is welcomed. Speech, when it brings no evil to others, is a pleasant thing.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: One is not called noble who harms living beings. By not harming living beings one is called noble.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: Being deeply learned and skilled, being well trained and using well spoken words: this is good luck.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: Just as a mother would protect her only child with her life, even so let one cultivate a boundless love towards all beings.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: In whom there is no sympathy for living beings: know him as an outcast.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: Let us rise up and be thankful, for if we didn’t learn a lot today, at least we learned a little, and if we didn’t learn a little, at least we didn’t get sick, and if we got sick, at least we didn’t die; so, let us all be thankful.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: Those attached to the notion ‘I am’ and to views roam the world offending people.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: There is nothing more dreadful than the habit of doubt. Doubt separates people. It is a poison that disintegrates friendships and breaks up pleasant relations. It is a thorn that irritates and hurts; it is a sword that kills.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: Men, driven on by thirst, run about like a snared hare; let therefore mendicant drive out thirst, by striving after passionlessness for himself.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: The whole secret of existence is to have no fear. Never fear what will become of you, depend on no one. Only the moment you reject all help are you freed.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: When one has the feeling of dislike for evil, when one feels tranquil, one finds pleasure in listening to good teachings; when one has these feelings and appreciates them, one is free of fear.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: The instant we feel anger we have already ceased striving for the truth, and have begun striving for ourselves.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: He is able who thinks he is able.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: It is a man’s own mind, not his enemy or foe, that lures him to evil ways.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: Delight in heedfulness! Guard well your thoughts!

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: Everything is based on mind, is led by mind, is fashioned by mind. If you speak and act with a polluted mind, suffering will follow you, as the wheels of the oxcart follow the footsteps of the ox.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: There is nothing so disobedient as an undisciplined mind, and there is nothing so obedient as a disciplined mind.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: You are a seeker. Delight in the mastery of your hands and your feet, of your words and your thoughts.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: See them, floundering in their sense of mine, like fish in the puddles of a dried-up stream — and, seeing this, live with no mine, not forming attachment for states of becoming.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: All experiences are preceded by mind, having mind as their master, created by mind.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: To enjoy good health, to bring true happiness to one’s family, to bring peace to all, one must first discipline and control one’s own mind. If a man can control his mind he can find the way to Enlightenment, and all wisdom and virtue will naturally come to him.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: All wrong-doing arises because of mind. If mind is transformed can wrong-doing remain?

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: What we are today comes from our thoughts of yesterday, and our present thoughts build our life of tomorrow: Our life is the creation of our mind.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: The one who has conquered himself is a far greater hero than he who has defeated a thousand times a thousand men.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: Transcendental intelligence rises when the intellectual mind reaches its limit and if things are to be realized in their true and essential nature, its processes of thinking must be transcended by an appeal to some higher faculty of cognition.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: The external world is only a manifestation of the activities of the mind itself, and the mind grasps it as an external world simply because of its habit of discrimination and false-reasoning. The disciple must get into the habit of looking at things truthfully.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: Mind precedes all mental states. Mind is their chief; they are all mind-wrought.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: If with a pure mind a person speaks or acts happiness follows him like his never-departing shadow.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: There is no path to happiness: happiness is the path.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: Happiness comes when your work and words are of benefit to yourself and others.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: Thousands of candles can be lighted from a single candle, and the life of the candle will not be shortened. Happiness never decreases by being shared. Buddha

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: Do not look for a sanctuary in anyone except your self.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: The enlightened one, intent on jhana, should find delight in the forest, should practice jhana at the foot of a tree, attaining his own satisfaction.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: Do not dwell in the past, do not dream of the future, concentrate the mind on the present moment.

quotes.author: buddha
quotes.quote: Set your heart on doing good. Do it over and over again, and you will be filled with joy.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: The more we value things outside our control, the less control we have.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: The best answer to anger is silence.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: The first step: Don’t be anxious. Nature controls it all.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: The second step: Concentrate on what you have to do. Fix your eyes on it. Remind yourself that your task is to be a good human being; remind yourself what nature demands of people. Then do it, without hesitation, and speak the truth as you see it. But with kindness. With humility. Without hypocrisy.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: To love only what happens, what was destined. No greater harmony.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Today I escaped anxiety. Or no, I discarded it, because it was within me, in my own perceptions – not outside.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Objective judgement, now, at this very moment. Unselfish action, now, at this very moment. Willing acceptance, now, at this very moment – of all external events. That’s all you need.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: How ridiculous and how strange to be surprised at anything which happens in life.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: You’re subject to sorrow, fear, jealousy, anger and inconsistency. That’s the real reason you should admit that you are not wise.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Almost nothing material is needed for a happy life, for he who has understood existence.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Receive wealth or prosperity without arrogance; and be ready to let it go.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: For God’s sake, stop honouring externals, quit turning yourself into the tool of mere matter, or of people who can supply you or deny you those material things.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: As the same fire assumes different shapes when it consumes objects differing in shape, so does the one self take the shape of every creature in whom he is present.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: A man when he has done a good act, does not call out for others to come and see, but he goes on to another act, as a vine goes on to produce again the grapes in season.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Remember: Matter. How tiny your share of it. Time. How brief and fleeting your allotment of it. Fate. How small a role you play in it.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Is any man afraid of change? What can take place without change? What then is more pleasing or more suitable to the universal nature? And can you take a hot bath unless the wood for the fire undergoes a change? And can you be nourished unless the food undergoes a change? And can anything else that is useful be accomplished without change? Do you not see then that for yourself also to change is just the same, and equally necessary for the universal nature?

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Receive without pride, let go without attachment.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: When you have assumed these names – good, modest, truthful, rational, a man of equanimity, and magnanimous – take care that you do not change these names; and if you should lose them, quickly return to them.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Let not your mind run on what you lack as much as on what you have already.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: If it is not right do not do it; if it is not true do not say it.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: I have often wondered how it is that every man loves himself more than all the rest of men, but yet sets less value on his own opinions of himself than on the opinions of others.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Be content with what you are, and wish not change; nor dread your last day, nor long for it.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Consider that before long you will be nobody and nowhere, nor will any of the things exist that you now see, nor any of those who are now living. For all things are formed by nature to change and be turned and to perish in order that other things in continuous succession may exist.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: He who follows reason in all things is both tranquil and active at the same time, and also cheerful and collected.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: In a word, if there is a god, all is well; and if chance rules, do not also be governed by it.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: So I look for the best and am prepared for the opposite.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Treat whatever happens as wholly natural; not novel or hard to deal with; but familiar and easily handled. (This is one of my favorite Marcus Aurelius quote. Leave a reply here and let me know what’s yours!)

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: The soul becomes dyed with the color of its thoughts.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Be content to seem what you really are.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Reject your sense of injury and the injury itself disappears.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: You have power over your mind – not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Very little is needed to make a happy life; it is all within yourself, in your way of thinking.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: It is not events that disturb people, it is their judgements concerning them.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: If it’s not right, don’t do it. If it’s not true, don’t say it.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: The best revenge is not to be like your enemy.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Accept the things to which fate binds you, and love the people with whom fate brings you together, but do so with all your heart.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Confine yourself to the present.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Straight, not straightenred.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: When you arise in the morning, think of what a precious privilege it is to be alive – to breathe, to think, to enjoy, to love.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Whatever happens to you has been waiting to happen since the beginning of time.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: That which is not good for the bee-hive cannot be good for the bees.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: To live happily is an inward power of the soul.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: You can commit injustice by doing nothing.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Waste no more time arguing about what a good man should be. Be one.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Do every act of your life as if it were your last.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: It is not death that a man should fear, but he should fear never beginning to live.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Character and self-control. (What Marcus learned from his grandfather Verus) (See also 8 Easy Ways To Increase Your Self-Control)

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Integrity and manliness. (What Marcus learned from his father)

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: To accept without arrogance, to let it go with indifference.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Each day provides its own gifts.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Anger cannot be dishonest.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Nothing natural is evil.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Nothing should be done without a purpose.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Even the smallest thing should be done with reference to an end.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Stick to what’s in front of you – idea, action, utterance.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: What is your art? To be good.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Give yourself a gift: the present moment.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: What illusion about myself do I entertain?

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: The rational animal is consequently also a social animal.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Glory’s an empty, changeable thing, as fickle as the weather.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Poverty is the mother of crime.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: A man should be upright, not be kept upright.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Receive without conceit, release without struggle.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Our life is what our thoughts make it.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Nothing happens to anyone that he can’t endure.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Dwell on the beauty of life. Watch the stars, and see yourself running with them.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Look well into thyself; there is a source of strength which will always spring up if thou wilt always look.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: When jarred, unavoidably, by circumstance, revert at once to yourself and don’t lose the rhythm more than you can help. You’ll have a better grasp of harmony if you keep going back to it.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: This one is a tough one. (But can be very motivating) So you were born to feel “nice”? Instead of doing things and experiencing them? Don’t you see the plants, the birds, the ants and spiders and bees going about their individual tasks, putting the world in order, as best they can? And you’re not willing to do your job as a human being? Why aren’t you running to do what your nature demands?

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: If you are distressed by anything external, the pain is not due to the thing itself, but to your estimate of it; and this you have the power to revoke at any moment.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Take the shortest route, the one that nature planned – to speak and act in the healthiest way. Do that, and be free of pain and stress, free of all calculation and pretention.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: The first rule is to keep an untroubled spirit. The second is to look things in the face and know them for what they are.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: As if you had died and your life had extended only to this present moment, use the surplus that is left to you to live from this time onward according to nature.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: There is nothing happens to any person but what was in his power to go through with.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: The true man is revealed in difficult times. So when trouble comes, think of yourself as a wrestler whom God, like a trainer, has paired with a tough young buck. For what purpose? To turn you into Olympic-class material. But this is going to take some sweat to accomplish.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: There were two vices much blacker and more serious than the rest: lack of persistence and lack of self-control… persist and resist.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: The universal order and the personal order are nothing but different expressions and manifestations of a common underlying principle.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Look within. Within is the foundation of good, and it will ever bubble up, if you will ever dig.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: The only wealth which you will keep forever is the wealth you have given away.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Nothing has such power to broaden the mind as the ability to investigate systematically and truly all that comes under thy observation in life.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Forward, as occasion offers. Never look round to see whether any shall note it… Be satisfied with success in even the smallest matter, and think that even such a result is no trifle.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Because a thing seems difficult for you, do not think it impossible for anyone to accomplish.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: It is in your power to live here. But if men do not permit you, then get away out of life, as if you were suffering no harm. The house is smoky, and I quit it. Why do you think that this is any trouble? But so long as nothing of the kind drives me out, I remain, am free, and no man shall hinder me from doing what I choose; and I choose to do what is according to the nature of the rational and social animal.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: If you didn’t learn these things in order to demonstrate them in practice, what did you learn them for?

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: People with a strong physical constitution can tolerate extremes of hot and cold; people of strong mental health can handle anger, grief, joy and the other emotions.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: And thou wilt give thyself relief, if thou doest every act of thy life as if it were the last.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: How long will you wait before you demand the best of yourself, and trust reason to determine what is best?

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: ‘I will throw you into prison.’ ‘Correction – it is my body you will throw there’.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: When faced with anything painful or pleasurable, anything bringing glory or disrepute, realize that the crisis is now, that the Olympics have started, and waiting is no longer an option; that the chance for progress, to keep or lose, turns on the events of a single day.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: In the morning, when you rise unwillingly, let this thought be present: I am rising to the work of a human being.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: No man can escape his destiny, the next inquiry being how he may best live the time that he has to live.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Do you have reason? I have. Why then do you not use it?

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Have I been made for this, to lie under the blankets and keep myself warm?

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: ‘But I get to wear a crown of gold.’ If you have your heart set on wearing crowns, why not make one out of roses – you will look even more elegant in that.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Who exactly are these people that you want to be admired by? Aren’t they the same people you are in the habit of calling crazy? And is this your life ambition, then – to win the approval of lunatics?

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Consider what men are when they are eating, sleeping, coupling, evacuating, and so forth. Then what kind of men they are when they are imperious and arrogant, or angry and scolding from their elevated place.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: How much time he saves who does not look to see what his neighbor says or does or thinks.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: For all their compliments do verses pay? They mayn’t, yet these same poems make me gay.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Conceal a flaw, and the world will imagine the worst.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: If you learn that someone is speaking ill of you, don’t try to defend yourself against the rumours; respond instead with, ‘Yes, and he doesn’t know the half of it, because he could have said more’.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: If someone responds to insult like a rock, what has the abuser gained with his invective?

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: He who has a vehement desire for posthumous fame does not consider that every one of those who remember him will himself also die very soon.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Let us overlook many things in those who are like antagonists in the gymnasium. For it is in our power, as I said, to get out of the way and to have no suspicion or hatred.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Begin – to begin is half the work, let half still remain; again begin this, and thou wilt have finished.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: It is just charming how people boast about qualities beyond their control. For instance, ‘I am better than you because I have many estates, while you are practically starving’; or, ‘I’m a consul,’ ‘I’m a governor,’ or ‘I have fine curly hair.’

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: How strangely men act. They will not praise those who are living at the same time and living with themselves; but to be themselves praised by posterity, by those whom they have never seen or ever will see, this they set much value on.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: “A cucumber is bitter.” Throw it away. “There are briars in the road.” Turn aside from them. This is enough. Do not add, “And why were such things made in the world?”

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Always observe how ephemeral and worthless human things are, and what was yesterday a speck of semen tomorrow will be a mummy or ashes.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Under no circumstances ever say ‘I have lost something,’ only ‘I returned it.’

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Each of us needs what nature gives us, when nature gives it.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Tomorrow is nothing, today is too late; the good lived yesterday.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Do little, if you want contentment of mind.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Misfortune nobly born is good fortune.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: To do harm is to do yourself harm. To do an injustice is to do yourself an injustice.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: If something does not make a person worse in himself, neither does it make his life worse, nor does it harm him without or within.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Death and life, success and failure, pain and pleasure, wealth and poverty, all these happen to good and bad alike, and they are neither noble nor shameful – and hence neither good nor bad.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: A rock is thrown in the air. It loses nothing by coming down, gained nothing by going up.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: To the wise, life is a problem; to the fool, a solution.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: The present is the only thing of which a man can be deprived, if it is true that this is the only thing which he has, and that a man cannot lose something he does not already possess.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: You must become an old man in good time if you wish to be an old man long.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Don’t believe your situation is genuinely bad – no one can make you do that. Is there smoke in the house? If it’s not suffocating, I will stay indoors; if it proves too much, I’ll leave. Always remember – the door is open.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: What springs from earth dissolves to earth again, and heaven-born things fly to their native seat.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Someone bathes in haste; don’t say he bathes badly, but in haste. Someone drinks a lot of wine; don’t say he drinks badly, but a lot. Until you know their reasons, how do you know that their actions are vicious?

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Consider that everything is opinion, and opinion is in your power. Take away then, when you choose, your opinion, and like a mariner who has rounded the headland, you will find calm, everything stable, and a waveless bay.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: The sexual embrace can only be compared with music and with prayer.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: The flaw which is hidden is deemed greater than it is.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Glory paid to our ashes comes too late.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: The universe is transformation: life is opinion.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: A vine cannot behave olively, nor an olive tree vinely – it is impossible, inconceivable. No more can a human being wholly efface his native disposition.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Since the greatest part of what we say and do is unnecessary, dispensing with such activities affords a man more leisure and less uneasiness.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: To have contemplated human life for forty years is the same as to have contemplated it for ten thousand years. For what more will you see?

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Passions stem from frustrated desire.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Everything that happens happens as it should, and if you observe carefully, you will find this to be so.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Each thing is of like form from everlasting and comes round again in its cycle.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Whatever man you meet with, immediately say to yourself: “What opinions has this man about good and bad?”

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: To the rational animal the same act is at once according to nature and according to reason.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Poverty’s no evil to anyone unless he kicks against it.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Take care that you don’t treat inhumanity as it treats human beings.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: A person’s worth is measured by the worth of what he values.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: An ignorant person is inclined to blame others for his own misfortune. To blame oneself is proof of progress. But the wise man never has to blame another or himself.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: The object of life is not to be on the side of the majority, but to escape finding oneself in the ranks of the insane.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: It never ceases to amaze me: we all love ourselves more than other people, but care more about their opinion than our own.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: The mind in itself has no needs, except for those it creates itself. Is undisturbed, except for its own disturbances. Knows no obstructions, except those from within.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Death and life, honor and dishonor, pain and pleasure — all these things equally happen to good men and bad, being things which make us neither better nor worse. Therefore they are neither good nor evil.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: A thing is neither better nor worse for having been praised.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: No one objects to what is useful to him. To be of use to others is natural. Then don’t object to what is useful to you – being of use.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: When I see that one thing [virtue] is supreme and most important, I cannot say that something else is, just to make you happy.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: A boxer derives the greatest advantage from his sparring partner – and my accuser is my sparring partner. He trains me in patience, civility and even temper.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Either you’re going to be depressed when your wish is not realized or foolishly pleased with yourself if it is, overjoyed for the wrong reasons.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: I say that virtue is more valuable than wealth to the same degree that eyes are more valuable than fingernails.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: How much more grievous are the consequences of anger than the causes of it.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Most of us dread the deadening of the body and will do anything to avoid it. About the deadening of the soul, however, we don’t care one iota.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Don’t let outward appearances mislead you into thinking that someone with more prestige, power or some other distinction must on that account be happy.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: As you are careful when you walk not to step on a nail or turn your ankle, so you should take care not to do any injury to your character at the same time.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: If you lost the capacity to read, or play music, you would think it was a disaster, but you think nothing of losing the capacity to be honest, decent and civilized.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Things do not touch the soul, for they are external and remain immovable; so our perturbations come only from our inner opinions.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: We are too much accustomed to attribute to a single cause that which is the product of several, and the majority of our controversies come from that.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Everything we hear is an opinion, not a fact. Everything we see is a perspective, not the truth.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Pleasures, when they go beyond a certain limit, are but punishments.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: As it is with a play, so it is with life – what matters is not how long the acting lasts, but how good it is. It is not important at what point you stop. Stop wherever you will – only make sure that you round it off with a good ending.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: He often acts unjustly who does not do a certain thing; not only he who does a certain thing.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: If someone is incapable of distinguishing good things from bad and neutral things from either – well, how could such a person be capable of love? The power to love, then, belongs only to the wise man.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Often injustice lies in what you aren’t doing, not only in what you are doing.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: To live the good life: We have the potential for it. If we can learn to be indifferent to what makes no difference.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Stop wishing for something else to happen, for a different fate. That is to live a false life.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Enough of this miserable, whining life. Stop monkeying around! Why are you troubled? What’s new here? What’s so confounding? The one responsible? Take a good look. Or just the matter itself? Then look at that. There’s nothing else to look at. And as far as the gods go, by now you could try being more straightforward and kind. It’s the same, whether you’ve examined these things for a hundred years, or only three.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Life is short. That’s all there is to say. Get what you can from the present – thoughtfully, justly.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: When someone is properly grounded in life, they shouldn’t have to look outside themselves for approval.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Mastery of reading and writing requires a master. Still, more so life.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Consider that as the heaps of sand piled on one another hide the former sands, so in life the events that go before are soon covered by those that come after.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: If, at some point in your life, you should come across anything better than justice, honesty, self-control, courage – than a mind satisfied that is has succeeded in enabling you to act rationally, and satisfied to accept what’s beyond its control – if you find anything better than that, embrace it without reservations – it must be an extraordinary thing indeed – and enjoy it to the full.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Where a man can live, he can also live well.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Treat what you don’t have as nonexistent. Look at what you have, the things you value most, and think of how much you’d crave them if you didn’t have them. But be careful. Don’t feel such satisfaction that you start to overvalue them – that it would upset you to lose them.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Just ask whether they put their self-interest in externals or in moral choice. If it’s in externals, you cannot call them friends, any more than you can call them trustworthy, consistent, courageous or free.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: While you live, while it is in your power, be good.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: What is the goal of virtue, after all, except a life that flows smoothly?

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: For where else is friendship found if not with fairness, reliability and respect for virtue only?

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: You will give yourself relief, if you do every act of your life as if it were the last.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Do not act as if you were going to live ten thousand years. Death hangs over you. While you live, while it is in your power, be good.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Be cheerful also, and do not seek external help or the tranquillity that others give. A man then must stand erect, not be kept erect by others.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: The art of life is more like the wrestler’s art than the dancer’s, in respect of this, that it should stand ready and firm to meet onsets that are sudden and unexpected.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: The object in life is not to be on the side of the majority, but to escape finding oneself in the ranks of the insane.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: The history of your life is now complete and your service is ended: and how many beautiful things you have seen; and how many pleasures and pains you have despised; and how many things called honorable you have spurned; and to how many ill-minded folks you have shown a kind disposition.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Life is neither good or evil, but only a place for good and evil.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Anything in any way beautiful derives its beauty from itself and asks nothing beyond itself. Praise is no part of it, for nothing is made worse or better by praise.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Every day as it comes should be welcomed and reduced forthwith into our own possession as if it were the finest day imaginable. What flies past has to be seized at.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: The art of living is more like wrestling than dancing.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Don’t hope that events will turn out the way you want, welcome events in whichever way they happen: this is the path to peace.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Nothing is as encouraging as when virtues are visibly embodied in the people around us, when we’re practically showered with them.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: The tranquillity that comes when you stop caring what they say. Or think, or do. Only what you do.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Do not indulge in dreams of having what you have not, but reckon up the chief of the blessings you do possess, and then thankfully remember how you would crave for them if they were not yours.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: When they’re really possessed by what they do, they’d rather stop eating and sleeping than give up practicing their arts.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: The things that are essential are acquired with little bother; it is the luxuries that call for toil and effort.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: When you wish to delight yourself, think of the virtues of those who live with you; for instance, the activity of one, the modesty of another, the liberality of a third, and some other good quality of a fourth.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: To the gods I am indebted for having good grandfathers, good parents, a good sister, good teachers, good associates, good kinsmen and friends, nearly everything good. For all these [blessings in my life] require the help of the gods and fortune.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: All you need are these: certainty of judgment in the present moment; action for the common good in the present moment; and an attitude of gratitude in the present moment for anything that comes your way.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Nothing is burdensome if taken lightly, and how nothing need arouse one’s irritation so long as one doesn’t make it bigger than it is by getting irritated.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: You can discard most of the junk that clutters your mind – things that exist only there – and clear out space for yourself.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Her reverence for the divine, her generosity, her inability not only to do wrong but even to conceive of doing it. And the simple way she lived – not in the least like the rich. (What Marcus learned from his mother)

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: If you seek tranquility, do less. Or do what’s essential – what the logos of a social being requires, and in the requisite way. Which brings a double satisfaction: to do less, better. Because most of what we say and do is not essential. If you can eliminate it, you’ll have more time, and more tranquility. Ask yourself at every moment, ‘Is this necessary?’

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Think not so much of what you lack as of what you have: but of the things that you have, select the best, and then reflect how eagerly you would have sought them if you did not have them.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Remind yourself that it is not the future or what has passed that afflicts you, but always the present.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Today I have got out of all trouble, or rather I have cast out all trouble, for it was not outside, but within and in my opinions.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Don’t waste the rest of your time here worrying about other people – unless it affects the common good. It will keep you from doing anything useful. You’ll be too preoccupied with what so-and-so is doing, and why, and what the’re saying, and what they’re thinking, and what they’re up to, and all the other things that throw you off and keep you from focusing on your own mind.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: You can pass your life in an equable flow of happiness if you can follow the right way and think and act in the right way.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Failure to observe what is in the mind of another has seldom made a man unhappy; but those who do not observe the movements of their own minds must of necessity be unhappy.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Stop allowing yourself your mind to be a slave, to be jerked about by selfish impulses, to kick against fate and the present, and to mistrust the future.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Set yourself in motion, if it is in your power, and do not look about you to see if anyone will observe it; nor yet expect Plato’s Republic: but be content if the smallest thing goes on well, and consider such an event to be no small matter.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Don’t set your mind on things you don’t possess, but count the blessings you actually possess and think how much you would desire them if they weren’t already yours.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts: therefore, guard accordingly, and take care that you entertain no notions unsuitable to virtue and reasonable nature.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Here is a rule to remember in future, when anything tempts you to feel bitter: not “This is misfortune,” but “To bear this worthily is good fortune.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: He who lives in harmony with himself lives in harmony with the universe.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: How soon will time cover all things, and how many it has covered already.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: How much time he gains who does not look to see what his neighbour says or does or thinks, but only at what he does himself, to make it just and holy.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: A key point to bear in mind: The value of attentiveness varies in proportion to its object. You’re better off not giving the small things more time than they deserve.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Forget everything else. Keep hold of this alone and remember it: Each of us lives only now, this brief instant. The rest has been lived already, or is impossible to see.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Brief is man’s life and small the nook of the earth where he lives; brief, too, is the longest posthumous fame, buoyed only by a succession of poor human beings who will very soon die and who know little of themselves, much less of someone who died long ago.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: How much time he saves who does not look to see what his neighbor says or does or thinks.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Altogether the interval is small between birth and death; and consider with how much trouble, and in company with what sort of people and in what a feeble body, this interval is laboriously passed.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Keep in mind how fast things pass by and are gone – those that are now and those to come. Existence flows past us like a river: the ‘what’ is in constant flux, the ‘why’ has a thousand variations. Nothing is stable, not even what’s right here. The infinity of past and future gapes before us – a chasm whose depths we cannot see.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Time is a river, a violent current of events, glimpsed once and already carried past us, and another follows and is done.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: How short is the time from birth to dissolution, and the illimitable time before birth as well as the equally boundless time after dissolution.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: The perfection of moral character consists in this, in passing every day as if it were the last, and in being neither violently excited nor torpid nor playing the hypocrite.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Think of all the years passed by in which you said to yourself “I’ll do it tomorrow,” and how the gods have again and again granted you periods of grace of which you have not availed yourself. It is time to realize that you are a member of the Universe, that you are born of Nature itself, and to know that a limit has been set to your time. Use every moment wisely, to perceive your inner refulgence, or ’twill be gone and nevermore within your reach.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Your life is short. You must turn to profit the present by the aid of reason and justice.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Not to waste time on nonsense. (What Marcus learned from Diognetus)

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Life is warfare… Then what can guide us? Only philosophy.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: No role is so well suited to philosophy as the one you happen to be in right now.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: The first thing a pretender to philosophy must do is get rid of their presuppositions; a person is not going to undertake to learn anything that they think they already know.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: People who are physically ill are unhappy with a doctor who doesn’t give them advice, because they think he has given up on them. Shouldn’t we feel the same towards a philosopher – and assume that he has given up hope of our ever becoming rational – if he will no longer tell us what we need (but may not like) to hear?

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Your mind will take the shape of what you frequently hold in thought, for the human spirit is colored by such impressions.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: My advice is really this: what we hear the philosophers saying and what we find in their writings should be applied in our pursuit of the happy life. We should hunt out the helpful pieces of teaching, and the spirited and noble-minded sayings which are capable of immediate practical application – not far-fetched or archaic expressions or extravagant metaphors and figures of speech – and learn them so well that words become works.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: The work of philosophy is simple and modest. Do not draw me aside into pomposity.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: It stares you in the face. No role is so well suited to philosophy as the one you happen to be in right now.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: This, then, is the beginning of philosophy – an awareness of one’s own mental fitness.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: This presumption that you possess knowledge of any use has to be dropped before you approach philosophy – just as if we were enrolling in a school of music or mathematics.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Reflect on the other social roles you play. If you are a council member, consider what a council member should do. If you are young, what does being young mean, if you are old, what does age imply, if you are a father, what does fatherhood entail? Each of our titles, when reflected upon, suggests the acts appropriate to it.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: What then can guide a man? One thing and only one, philosophy. But this consists in keeping the daimon within a man free from violence and unharmed, superior to pains and pleasures, doing nothing without a purpose, nor yet falsely and with hypocrisy.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: If you commit to philosophy, be prepared at once to be laughed at and made the butt of many snide remarks.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: My city and country, so far as I am Antoninus, is Rome; but so far as I am a man, it is the world.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Do you want to know if you are educated? Show us your values, philosopher.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: You don’t love yourself enough. Or you’d love your nature too, and what it demands of you.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Consider if you have behaved to all in such a way that this way be said of you: Never has he wronged a man in deed or word.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: What is divine deserves our affection because it is good; what is human deserves our affection because it is like us.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: People who love what they do wear themselves down doing it, they even forget to wash or eat.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Adapt yourself to the life you have been given; and truly love the people with whom destiny has surrounded you.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: The spiritual meaning of love is measured by what it can do. Love is meant to heal. Love is meant to renew. Love is meant to bring us closer to God.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: [Treat] unenlightened souls with sympathy and indulgence, remembering that they are ignorant or mistaken about what’s most important. Never be harsh, remember Plato’s dictum: ‘Every soul is deprived of the truth against its will.’

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Shall any man hate me? That will be his affair. But I will be mild and benevolent toward every man, and ready to show even him his mistake, not reproachfully, nor yet as making a display of my endurance, but nobly and honestly.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Accustom yourself to attend carefully to what is said by another, and as much as it is possible, try to inhabit the speaker’s mind.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: In your conversation, don’t dwell at excessive length on your own deeds or adventures. Just because you enjoy recounting your exploits doesn’t mean that others derive the same pleasure from hearing about them.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: One thing here is worth a great deal: to pass your life in truth and justice, with a benevolent disposition even to liars and unjust men.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Refer your action to no other end than the common good.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Do not be whirled about, but in every movement have respect to justice, and on the occasion of every impression maintain the faculty of comprehension or understanding.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: If a man is mistaken, instruct him kindly and show him his error. But if you are not able, blame yourself, or not even yourself.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: When you have trouble getting out of bed in the morning, remember that your defining characteristic – what defines a human being — is to work with others. Even animals know how to sleep. And it’s the characteristic activity that’s the more natural one – more innate and more satisfying.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Is helping others less valuable to you? Not worth your effort?

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: From my brother Severus to love my kin, and to love truth, and to love justice. (What Marcus learned from Severus)

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: To show intuitive sympathy for friends, tolerance to amateurs and sloppy thinkers. (What Marcus learned from Sextus)

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: From Sextus to tolerate ignorant persons, and those who form opinions without consideration. (What Marcus learned from Sextus)

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: To have learned how to accept favors from friends without losing your self-respect or appearing ungrateful. (What Marcus learned from Apollonius)

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: His respect for people who practiced philosophy – at least, those who were sincere about it. But without denigrating the others – or listening to them. (What Marcus learned from his adopted father)

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Never value anything as profitable that compels you to break your promise, to lose your self-respect, to hate any man, to suspect, to curse, to act the hypocrite, to desire anything that needs walls and curtains.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Only attend to yourself, and resolve to be a good man in every act that you do.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: We ought to do good to others as simply as a horse runs, or a bee makes honey, or a vine bears grapes season after season without thinking of the grapes it has borne.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Men exist for the sake of one another.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Adapt yourself to the things among which your lot has been cast and love sincerely the fellow creatures with whom destiny has ordained that you shall live.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: What is your art? To be good. And how is this accomplished well except by general principles, some about the nature of the universe, and others about the proper constitution of man?

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: People exist for one another. You can instruct or endure them.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: As an antidote to battle unkindness we were given kindness.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: What is your vocation? To be a good person.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: No longer talk at all about the kind of man that a good man ought to be, but be such.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Whatever any one does or says, I must be good, just as if the emerald (or the gold or the purple) were always saying “Whatever any one does or says, I must be emerald and keep my color.”

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: First, do nothing inconsiderately or without a purpose. Second, make your acts refer to nothing else but a social end.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: When a guide meets up with someone who is lost, ordinarily his reaction is to direct him on the right path, not mock or malign him, then turn on his heel and walk away. As for you, lead someone to the truth and you will find that he can follow. But as long as you don’t point it out to him, don’t make fun of him; be aware of what you need to work on instead.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: That no one could ever have felt patronized by him – or in a position to patronize him. A sense of humour. (What Marcus learned from Maximus)

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: No matter what anyone says or does, my task is to be good.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: If you have been placed in a position above others, are you automatically going to behave like a despot? Remember who you are and whom you govern – that they are kinsmen, brothers by nature, fellow descendants of Zeus.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: ‘Well, what will my profession in the community be?’ Whatever position you are equipped to fill, so long as you preserve the man of trust and integrity.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Perhaps there are none more lazy, or more truly ignorant, than your everlasting readers.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Let men see, let them know, a real man, who lives as he was meant to live.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: To be feared is to fear: no one has been able to strike terror into others and at the same time enjoy peace of mind himself.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Have I done something for the common good? Then I share in the benefits. To stay centered on that. Not to give up.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: The secret of all victory lies in the organization of the non-obvious.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: A man’s worth is no greater than his ambitions.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Another person will not hurt you without your cooperation; you are hurt the moment you believe yourself to be.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Ambition means tying your well-being to what other people say or do. Self-indulgence means tying it to the things that happen to you. Sanity means tying it to your own actions.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: To understand the true quality of people, you must look into their minds, and examine their pursuits and aversions.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: A noble man compares and estimates himself by an idea which is higher than himself; and a mean man, by one lower than himself. The one produces aspiration; the other ambition, which is the way in which a vulgar man aspires.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: The following are non-sequiturs: ‘I am richer, therefore superior to you’; or ‘I am a better speaker, therefore a better person, than you’.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Something good should be a source of pride, correct? ‘Yes.’ And can one really take pride in a momentary pleasure? Please don’t say yes.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: All our efforts must be directed towards an end, or we will act in vain. If it is not the right end, we will fail utterly.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: So when you hear that even life and the like are indifferent, don’t become apathetic; and by the same token, when you’re advised to care about them, don’t become superficial and conceive a passion for externals.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Whenever externals are more important to you than your own integrity, then be prepared to serve them the remainder of your life.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Being attached to many things, we are weighed down and dragged along with them.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Nothing important comes into being overnight; even grapes or figs need time to ripen. If you say that you want a fig now, I will tell you to be patient. First, you must allow the tree to flower, then put forth fruit; then you have to wait until the fruit is ripe. So if the fruit of a fig tree is not brought to maturity instantly or in an hour, how do you expect the human mind to come to fruition, so quickly and easily?

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Never get into family fights over material things; give them up willingly, and your moral standing will increase in proportion.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: If you are pained by external things, it is not they that disturb you, but your own judgement of them. And it is in your power to wipe out that judgement now.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: To be sure, external things of whatever kind require skill in their use, but we must not grow attached to them; whatever they are, they should only serve for us to show how skilled we are in our handling of them.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Do as Socrates did, never replying to the question of where he was from with, ‘I am Athenian,’ or ‘I am from Corinth,’ but always, ‘I am a citizen of the world.’

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Just prove to me that you are trustworthy, high-minded and reliable, and that your intentions are benign – prove to me that your jar doesn’t have a hole in it – and you’ll find that I won’t even wait for you to open your heart to me, I’ll be the first to implore you to lend an ear to my own affairs.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: When you have done a good act and another has received it, why do you look for a third thing besides these, as fools do, either to have the reputation of having done a good act or to obtain a return?

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: If money is your only standard, then consider that, by your lights, someone who loses their nose does not suffer any harm.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: It is not right that anything of any other kind, such as praise from the many, or power, or enjoyment of pleasure, should come into competition with that which is rationally and politically and practically good.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Perhaps the desire of the thing called fame torments you. See how soon everything is forgotten, and look at the chaos of infinite time on each side of the present, and the emptiness of applause, and the fickleness and lack of judgment in those who pretend to give praise, and the narrowness of its domain, and be quiet at last.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: You have leisure or ability to check arrogance: you have leisure to be superior to pleasure and pain: you have leisure to be superior to love of fame, and not to be vexed at stupid and ungrateful people, nay even to care for them.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Or is it your reputation that’s bothering you? But look at how soon we’re all forgotten. The abyss of endless time that swallows it all. The emptiness of those applauding hands. The people who praise us; how capricious they are, how arbitrary. And the tiny region it takes place. The whole earth a point in space – and most of it uninhabited.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Give thyself time to learn something new and good, and cease to be whirled around.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Despise not death, but welcome it, for nature wills it like all else.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Imagine you were now dead, or had not lived before his moment. Now view the rest of your life as a bonus.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Think of yourself as dead. You have lived your life. Now take what’s left and live it properly.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: A brief existence is common to all things, and yet you avoid and pursue all things as if they would be eternal.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Death. The end of sense-perception, of being controlled by our emotions, of mental activity, of enslavement to our bodies.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: You could leave life right now. Let that determine what you do and say and think.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Death and pain are not frightening, it’s the fear of pain and death we need to fear. Which is why we praise the poet who wrote, ‘Death is not fearful, but dying like a coward is.’

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: On the occasion of every act ask yourself, “How is this with respect to me? Will I regret it? A little time and I am dead, and all is gone”.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Speaking for myself, I hope death overtakes me when I’m occupied solely with the care of my character, in an effort to make it passionless, free, unrestricted and unrestrained.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Not to live as if you had endless years ahead of you. Death overshadows you. While you’re alive and able – be good.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Death, like birth, is a secret of Nature.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: When somebody’s wife or child dies, to a man we all routinely say, ‘Well, that’s part of life.’ But if one of our own family is involved, then right away it’s ‘Poor, poor me!’ We would do better to remember how we react when a similar loss afflicts others.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Every part of me then will be reduced by change into some part of the universe, and that again will change into another part of the universe, and so on forever.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Since it is possible that you might depart from life this very moment, regulate every act and thought accordingly.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Think continually that all kinds of men, pursuits, and nations are dead.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: How quickly things disappear: in the universe the bodies themselves, but in time the memory of them.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Whether it is a dispersion, or a resolution into atoms, or annihilation, it is either extinction or change.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Finally, waiting for death with a cheerful mind, as being nothing else than a dissolution of the elements of which every living being is compounded. But if there is no harm to the elements themselves in each continually changing into another, why should a man have any apprehension about the change and dissolution of all the elements?

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Death is necessary and cannot be avoided. I mean, where am I going to go to get away from it?

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Think not disdainfully of death, but look on it with favor; for even death is one of the things that Nature wills.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: One thing I know: all the works of mortal man lie under sentence of mortality; we live among things that are destined to perish.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Death is a release from the impressions of the senses, and from desires that make us their puppets, and from the vagaries of the mind, and from the hard service of the flesh.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Because we’re the only animals who not only die but are conscious of it even while it happens, we are beset by anxiety.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: This, then, is consistent with the character of a reflecting man, to be neither careless nor impatient nor contemptuous with respect to death, but to wait for it as one of the operations of nature.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: The act of dying is one of the acts of life.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: Death is not an evil. What is it then? The one law mankind has that is free of all discrimination.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: (A tough one) There is no man so fortunate that there shall not be by him when he is dying some who are pleased with what is going to happen.

quotes.author: marcus aurelius
quotes.quote: I cannot escape death, but at least I can escape the fear of it.
